ygData.subject: RE: Necro balancing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ll be honest.  I started a druid because I was tired of feeling so weak as a bard.  I also only play him when my similiar level friend is around.  SoW is
ygData.messageBody:
> welcome in groups because the general idea is that they have solo'd their
> way through the levels, etc. (That doesn't effect me. I only play
> my druid when my friend is around and I always play with her same-
> level monk. Then we see what else we can gather. But a lot of time
> its just the two of us.)

I'll be honest. I started a druid because I was tired of feeling
so weak as a bard. I also only play him when my similiar level
friend is around. SoW is too slow, mana constraints bite, melee
is much more horrible. However, I can stroll into any place my
bard would go and in solo mode perform 3x or 4x better. I actually
went from L16 to L17 all on my own soloing in one night. It was
very refreshing. Boring, but a change of pace.

My druid is almost L21 but I havent played him much because I love
my bard. There are times when I'd like to press a few buttons and
kill things quickly. That was something my bard could never do.

Harmonic.

and Dagato Catnip! lol... hope you don't mind, Cat - it was pure
admiration, not a lack of creativity.
